definition: to shake hands
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: We shooke hands and parted (as) friends.
We in the summer wind, say take care, good-bye.
sentences.chinese: 我们在夏天的风里握别，说一声珍重，再见。

sentences.english: Could you say goodbye to yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 你能否握别昨天的一切？

definition: to take one's leave/to bid farewell
reluctant to part
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
leave-taking/to say goodbye
to take leave of/to leave/separation
precious/extremely valuable/(honorific) Please take good care of yourself!
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to meet (by chance)/to come across
to see each other/to meet in person
on parting/facing separation
to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
goodbye/see you again later
a long period of separation
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to turn around/to look back/to recollect
